description.displayText: Betty is a warm and caring person. She is calming and reassuring.  My mother is 93 years old and has memory issues and had a medical setback in March. Betty has played an intricate part the last six months in caring for my mother and helping her get back to a better place in life.
description.originalText: Betty is a warm and caring person. She is calming and reassuring.  My mother is 93 years old and has memory issues and had a medical setback in March. Betty has played an intricate part the last six months in caring for my mother and helping her get back to a better place in life.

description.displayText: I cannot say enough about Betty. She was hired to care for my father as he battled stage 4 brain cancer. Betty became more than a caretaker, she became family. Her calm, caring manner was unwavering, and my father treasured her deeply. The care she provided for him was extraordinary, any family would be lucky to have her work for them. My father was incredibly well taken care of and regardless of the situation, Betty was there. She made our lives manageable during an unmanageable situation.
description.originalText: I cannot say enough about Betty. She was hired to care for my father as he battled stage 4 brain cancer. Betty became more than a caretaker, she became family. description.displayText: Betty is an amazing caregiver. My dad suffered from dementia which became progressively advanced. Betty cared for my dad for 3 years from his earliest stages of dementia to his last day. Betty possesses all of the skills, passion, patience and dedication that anyone could ask for to take care of a loved one. She handled all of the day to day necessities that my dad needed to maintain his quality of life, which became progressively more difficult as his condition worsened. She handled everything from taking him for activities, meals, medicine and hygiene to incontinence care. But even more amazing than the way she cared for him, was that she became his most trusted companion, and there are no words than can express what that meant to us. Despite his debilitating disease Betty was able to provide my dad with the highest quality of life both physically and emotionally and he remained happy to his last day. She became nothing less than a caring family member. Her kindness and integrity is priceless and I give Betty my highest recommendation. I say with absolute conviction that any family in need of a caregiver for a loved one would be very fortunate and blessed to have her.
